title: Drobo 5D Unboxing & Speed Test with Peter Hurley
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley unboxes the new Drobo 5D, highlights its features like Thunderbolt connectivity and 5-bay capacity, and performs a real-world speed test transferring 47GB of data.

steps.action: Introduction to the importance of reliable storage for photography files.
Preparing to install 4TB hard drives into the 5 available slots.
Reviewing the drive status and capacity using the Drobo Dashboard software.
Initiating a file transfer of 47GB to test Thunderbolt speeds.
Observing the transfer speed, noting it takes only about 5 minutes for 47GB.

key_takeaways: The Drobo 5D features Thunderbolt technology for high-speed data transfer.
It has 5 drive bays, allowing for significant storage capacity (e.g., 20TB with 4TB drives).
Real-world transfer speeds are impressive, moving ~47GB in approximately 5 minutes.
The unit is more compact than the previous Drobo Pro model.
